name: Reno Velleses
narrative: Velleses wielded a machete in a shopping plaza and nearly struck an officer. He was shot by two patrol officers.

name: Herbden Gabriel
narrative: Gabriel was being pursued in a robbery case. When police officers caught up to him at a shopping center, he held his hands up with one hand on his gun, according to news reports. Then, "he actually came down a little bit with his gun" and police shot him.

name: Mark Ahnee
narrative: Ahnee fired at officers with a shotgun before he was shot several times by police officers pursuing him on foot at Kalanianaole Highway and Ainakoa Avenue. Read more: https://bit.ly/2YtNcpT

name: Michael Kahana Davis
narrative: Police say Davis was trying to steal a car in a parking lot and fired at responding officers with an "improvised firearm," according to the Honolulu Star-Advertiser. An officer returned fire and shot him.

name: Aaron Torres
narrative: Torres called 911 while hallucinating. When officers responded, he resisted being taken into custody for a mental health evaluation. He died after three officers pinned him face down on the ground, cuffed him behind his back and shackled his legs. His family later won $1.4 million from the city in a wrongful death settlement. Read more: https://bit.ly/2AZWYIq

name: Gregory Gordon
narrative: Gordon, a Schofield Barracks soldier who the medical examiner says was drunk at the time, was driving the wrong way down a one-way street. In his attempt to flee, he hit a pole and parked cars and injured three officers before he was fatally shot.

name: Stephen Dinnan
narrative: Dinnan choked to death after his chest was pressed to the ground by a police officer and an off-duty firefighter. His family later won a $1 million settlement against the city.

name: Victor Rivera
narrative: Police responding to a domestic dispute fired 14 times at Rivera, striking him nine times. Rivera, who was diagnosed with schizophrenia, was armed with a mango picker. The city later paid $650,000 in settlement to his family. Read more: https://bit.ly/2UF5YJJ

name: Richard Lee Nelson
narrative: Nelson allegedly fled from officers after he was spotted with an open alcoholic beverage container in his car. During the chase, he rear-ended a city bus and nearly struck an officer before being fatally shot.

name: James Pickard Jr.
narrative: According to police, Pickard drove at officers after being spotted in a stolen vehicle. Police fired at him seven times. His car then rolled into a rock wall.

name: Sheldon Haleck
location_specific: King Street in front of Iolani Palace
narrative: Haleck, a former Hawaii Air National Guardsman, was reportedly behaving erratically and refusing to leave the roadway. He was on foot. Responding officers Tased, pepper sprayed and restrained him multiple times. The official cause of death was multiple metabolic and cardiac complications. The report also noted Haleck was also “acutely intoxicated” with methamphetamine. A jury in a civil lawsuit brought by the family later found officers did not use excessive force.

name: Walden Dang
narrative: Police responded after a man called to say his uncle was wielding a butcher knife at an apartment complex on Kinau Street. HPD told the Star-Advertiser that Dang threatened the officers with knives before they fired at him.

name: Dwain Lasit
narrative: Unknown circumstances. Media reports unavailable.

name: Pekelo Sanchez
narrative: Sanchez and a 19-year-old female companion were sleeping in a stolen vehicle outside an Aiea subdivision when police knocked on the windows. A lawsuit filed by his family says Sanchez was shot when he reached for the keys. Police at the time said Sanchez refused to exit the vehicle and then attempted to evade them, dragging a pair of officers across the parking lot, ramming the truck into two townhouses and a parked vehicle, according to a Honolulu Star-Advertiser report of the police account.

name: Cameron Johnson
narrative: Police say Johnson was in a stolen vehicle at Malaekahana Beach Park when an officer approached him. Johnson tried to drive the vehicle into the officer, who then shot him, police say. According to a wrongful death suit filed in 2019, Johnson was alone in the vehicle and did not run into the officer. Instead, witnesses said, the officer had a brief conversation with Johnson at the driver’s side window, took a step back and started firing. The case is pending.

name: Freddie Whitmore
narrative: Whitmore, a drug suspect inside a McCully high-rise, was shot and killed by a police officer after refusing the officer’s order to put down his loaded Glock pistol, according to HPD. Read more: https://bit.ly/3huAU9F

name: Michael Perez
narrative: Perez was suspected of stealing alcohol from a convenience store. He was allegedly wielding a knife and threatening officers repeatedly before he was Tased and then fatally shot.

name: Steven Allan Kaluahinui Hyer Jr.
narrative: Hyer was reportedly shot and killed at his Sunset Beach home following a seven-hour standoff with police, during which he stabbed a police dog with an arrow. Hyer was a disabled Air Force veteran.

name: Tison Dinney
narrative: Police responded to reports of a machete-wielding man near the Capitol. When they got there, Dinney’s machete and 12-inch garden shears were on the ground. Body camera footage showed Dinney looking confused in an alley as officers tried to coax him out. When officers surprised him from behind, he bent down to grab garden shears. HPD says he struck an officer with the shears. He was shot several times and Tased.

name: Gavalynn Mahuka
narrative: Police tried to serve a temporary restraining order against Mahuka, who barricaded himself inside his home. After a seven-hour standoff with police, he pointed a shotgun at the officers and shots were exchanged, police said.

name: Renie Cablay
narrative: Cablay, a correctional officer on leave from his job at the Oahu jail, allegedly lunged at an officer with a large knife during a six-hour standoff at his apartment before he was fatally shot, according to police and news reports.

name: Dustin Spencer
narrative: Spencer died after police officers fired multiple shots at him at a Nissan car dealership following an across-town chase starting in Pearl City, police and news reports say.

name: Siatuu Tauai Jr.
narrative: Tauai was fatally shot after police said he struck an officer with his car during a traffic stop near the Kamehameha Shopping Center.

name: Dana Brown
narrative: Brown was observed by a patrol officer traveling the wrong way on a moped. Following a chase on foot, Brown allegedly lunged at the officer with a knife. The officer deployed his Taser, but when it appeared to have no effect, he fired his weapon, police say.

name: Michael Kahalehoe
narrative: Kahalehoe was suspected in a series of armed robberies when officers located him at a Kapolei gas station. Officers shot about 20 rounds at Kahalehoe, who they said was driving at them. Police said they found a gun in his waistband.

name: Kyle Thomas
narrative: Thomas, who was suspected of shoplifting at a Walmart, allegedly ignored officers' commands and drove toward them with his vehicle before being fatally shot.

name: Danny Colton
narrative: Unknown Circumstances. Media reports unavailable.

name: Peter Purcell
narrative: Unknown circumstances. Media reports unavailable.

name: Sherianne Leinaala
narrative: Nixon's family said she fell into a coma after being taken into HPD custody in connection with assault accusations. She reportedly struggled with officers, who restrained her, after which she became unresponsive. She died a day later.

name: Dallas Pearce
armed: Something That Looked Like A Gun/Vehicle
narrative: Police said plainclothes HPD officers were tracking down Pearce, who had escaped from the Laumaka Work Furlough Center. Officers struggled with Pearce, who was in a vehicle, and shot him.

name: Caillen Paoakea Gentzler
narrative: Two HPD officers approached a residence to serve a warrant in connection with a kidnapping case, according to reports. Gentzler reportedly fled and got in a vehicle, revving the engine and reversing the car. He then allegedly accelerated towards officers, who shot him.

name: Isaiah Pama
narrative: HPD officers responded to Ka Hanahou Circle where Pama was allegedly arguing with a bystander and lying in a truck that didn't belong to him. Police said Pama kicked the inside of the truck before he got out and struggled with the officer. A second officer arrived and handcuffed him, then a third officer put leg shackles on him. Pama became unresponsive and died at the scene.

name: Iremamber Sykap
narrative: Sykap was allegedly driving a stolen vehicle linked to other crimes. Officers pursued him from Kawaikui Beach Park to the intersection of Kalakaua Avenue and Philip Street, where officers blocked the vehicle after it drove into oncoming traffic. Police say the vehicle rammed two police cars and crashed through a chainlink fence when officers fired multiple shots, before crashing into a canal. Four other individuals — three of them teens — were involved.

name: Lindani Myeni
narrative: Myeni allegedly entered a Nuuanu home and showed "odd behavior" and later assaulted three police officers who responded. An officer deployed his Taser unsuccessfully, news reports say. Two officers shot him.
